snippet: Law enforcement officials said that Jérôme Valcke, FIFA’s secretary general, made a 2008 bank transfer to a soccer official accused of taking a bribe.
abstract: United States officials say Jerome Valcke, secretary general of FIFA, transferred $10 million in 2008 from soccer organization bank account to soccer official Jack Warner, who is accused of bribery; Valcke is top lieutenant to FIFA president Sepp Blatter, and his involvement is sure to raise more questions about Blatter's potential links to corruption.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and MATT APUZZO

lead_paragraph: Law enforcement officials said that Jérôme Valcke, FIFA’s secretary general, made a 2008 bank transfer to a soccer official accused of taking a bribe.

headline.main: Bribery Inquiry Drawing Closer to FIFA’s President, Sepp Blatter
headline.print_headline: Bribery Inquiry Drawing Closer to FIFA’s Chief

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
